hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
rapport my name is Dave and this is
episode 1662 a and today's date is
September 12 2018 and the title the
episode is central bankers are desperate
first test case in the u.s. ready let's
get into the economic collapse financial
news now we are about to see the perfect
storm and I'm not talking about the
hurricane that's off the coast of the
Carolinas which is going to be horrible
the way the news is reporting it and if
it does hit land I wish all the people
the best they are hopefully prepared for
it and I hope everyone gets through it
and they're safe and they evacuated and
things like that but we do have a
perfect storm coming and when I say a
perfect storm we need to understand that
what is happening all at the same time
we have the FISA warrant the twenty
pages are going to be unredacted we're
going to see the Inspector General
report Declassified we're going to see
the economy fall apart at the same time
the central bank the head of the Fed
right now most likely is working with
Trump to raise the interest rates to
bring down the system we have Trump
manipulating the economic statistics
just like the past presidents just like
the central bank and the deep state have
done in the past but they are pushing
the economy to the street to the extreme
pushing it to where nobody can say Trump
crashed the economy because if you
notice he continually tweets out the
economy is doing fantastically look at
the numbers look at unemployment these
are statistical numbers if you notice
he's using all of the same exact data
points that everyone else has used and
they can't argue with it because if they
start to argue with it and start to pick
it apart
guess what he turns around and he says
well these are the numbers that you gave
us this is what we've been doing for a
long time you've been using the same
calculations you're telling us they're
manipulated how is this possible this is
why they're not going to do this
and while this entire system starts to
implode on itself we're going to see
cracks all over the place we're already
seeing cracks right now we've been
talking about real-estate retail the
corporate buybacks
the loaning the interbank loaning we've
been talking about all of this stuff and
we've been seeing that everywhere we
look we're seeing problems in the
economy yes if we look at the
unemployment numbers you see nothing if
you look at the GDP numbers you see
nothing if you look at the stock market
you see nothing but if you really take a
close look at what's really going on in
the US economy and the global economy
you can see that everything is breaking
down list let's take for example the
housing market the housing market has
been pumped up what they've done is
they've taken 20 cities the central bank
has been issuing free money and these
hedge funds investment companies have
pumped up all of these cities to prices
that we've never seen before actually
there are a lot higher than they were
back in 2008 right before everything
started to collapse and interest rates
were very very low this way it made it
easy for people to get loans and
actually it brings more people into the
market because the lower the interest
rate the further your money goes or I
should say currency goes you don't have
to make that much if the interest rates
come down if the interest rates move up
and you're making the same salary it
bumps you out of the market you can't
afford the house that you want and then
you have to look for a less expensive
house and many people say well I'm not
going to do this because this is not
what I want and as the interest rates
continually move up it continually
pushes people out of that market and
brings them down to the next level this
is what we're seeing right now as the
rates move up we're starting to see
everything completely break down I mean
if we look at us home refinancing it has
fallen to the lowest level since 2000
that is December 2000 we see refinancing
fell on existing homes by 5.9 percent
and if and I think or I should say when
when the Fed decides to raise the rates
again
September we're going to see refinancing
existing home purchases new home
purchases fall to levels like we've
never seen before and it's going to hit
every single market in the u.s. those
markets that are seeing you know prices
hit an all-time high and people saying
everything was great
remember they were saying this back
prior to 2008 2009 and everything came
crashing down now the central banks they
realize and we discussed as many times
before that this economy cannot continue
like this remember they didn't plan it
they didn't plan on this economy to go
this long they thought we would be in an
event right now a war it'd be very easy
to cover it up and this is what they've
done in the past they thought they were
gonna have someone else in office and
this way they could say listen everyone
has to sacrifice we're at war this is
why you're not seeing groceries on the
shelves this is why it's hard to get
fuel and we could see that the economy
is not doing well because everything has
maneuvered to wartime manufacturing the
wait a minute we don't have that much
manufacturing here so the economy would
hurt even further and also it'll give
the excuse of the central bankers to
create currency like there was no
tomorrow
well they don't have any of that right
now and they're scrambling right now
because they know what's coming they
understand that this system is going to
implode any minute and the way Trump and
the Patriots have set this up they're
getting ready to blame the central bank
blame the deep state and reset
everything so the central bank's they're
still in the same agenda they haven't
changed because they do believe that
they will be in control moving forward
they never think that they'll ever lose
control because they're always thinking
of the next thing that they can do to
regain control and this is what they're
doing so right now we know that
throughout the world they've been
experimenting with all different things
like universal basic income where they
shut down the banks also where they had
bail-ins they've been trying all
different things well it's the u.s. the
US has turned now they're going to test
something here and it's going to be
tested in Chicago and we know that Rahm
he's not seeking to look for another
term he's going to leave his position
but he's creating this task force that
will analyze whether the city should
establish a so-called universal basic
income program now this is very
interesting we know that Chicago is a
disaster
high crime the pension system is a
completely broken it's it's unfixable
right now the city has many many
problems but to keep everyone happy to
make sure that this universal basic
income system works they need to test it
out and they tried this in many
different areas around the world and the
u.s. is now on the list now it wasn't
really Rahm Emmanuel's idea it was first
floated by Chicago alderman Amy Pawar
who is running for the governor of
Illinois this November and he called on
Emanuel to launch a pilot program which
pit which would pay a thousand families
$500 each month to keep people happy and
then they're going to expand that to
more families and maybe even raise the
monthly amount now $500 a month if
you're thinking about this it's really
not that much I mean think about it if
you're living in an apartment your rent
is going to be what three four five six
hundred maybe even more than that so yes
maybe this will help you pay for that
apartment but anything else it's still
going to come out of your own pocket so
eventually what we're going to say is
we're going to probably see this amount
move up because they're gonna start to
realize that it was okay but we need to
give them more now they're doing this
because they want to keep people happy
remember the central bank they want
people dependent on the central bank
they want people dependent on government
they want people dependent and not
independent and this is part of their
plan to keep everyone happy because when
this system comes down they don't want
people pointing to the central bank to
blame the central bank for the economy
crashing but I think it's a little too
late right now I believe a
- a while ago and they were testing it
out but I think at this point people are
going to realize because it's going to
be pointed out that it was the central
bank that was the problem and we're
already seeing the narratives of the Fed
bringing down the economy because they
were raising the interest rates and of
course what they're going to do is
they're going to march economists out
there and they're going to show you how
the Fed actually brought down the
economy it's very easy to do I mean all
you have to do is go back in time and go
to 2006 7 and then 2008 show how the
interest rates went up show how
everything started to break down people
start to leave their houses real estate
started to fall and everything started
to implode on itself all they have to do
is do the same exact thing and then show
how all of a sudden it as everything
started to collapse they started to low
the lower the interest rates in
2008-2009 came down straight down like
an elevator that got its cables cut and
the elevator just fell
they brought the interest rates down and
we know that most of the central banks
around the world they can't really raise
interest rates because they know it's
going to implode the entire economic
system so the central banks they're
trying they're desperate right now
they're trying to do whatever they
possibly can to keep the system moving
forward because they're trying to think
of a way out of this now we know that
the mainstream media they're becoming
very nervous because they're saying hey
listen fed don't raise the interest
rates anymore this is it this should be
the last one they were doing this very
very quickly and I remember going back a
year ago they were all for it let's
raise it let's keep raising it because
they knew that this was going to be
blamed on Trump now everything has been
turned around Trump has the magic wand
this was his tweet to Obama because
Obama said it would take a magic wand to

Trump says well I have the magic wand
and we're gonna do much better which
means he has control over the
manipulation of all these numbers he can
control it and make it look like any way
he wanted to just like they've done in
the past he has control most likely over
the Fed because Powell I do believe is
working with him so we're going to be
going through this transition and we're
seeing a
perfect storm hit think about all the
things that are happening right now the
economy is declining very very quickly
if you look past the unemployment
numbers GDP numbers and stock market
numbers which really don't give you a

and we also have the release of

sitting president was spying on a
president that was coming into office
and we could see there's a lot of
corruption within this entire group when
all this hits and more truth comes out
this is the perfect storm and it's not
going to be easy for a lot of people
because people have not been preparing
for this I mean think about the
hurricane right now if you know anyone
in the South Carolina Carolina area you
know like the store shelves are
completely empty people are evacuating
there's no batteries there's no fuel
people were on line for fuel miles and
miles back when they got to the pump
there was absolutely nothing think about
when we go through this transition and
yes in the beginning stages it's going
to be bumpy you think everyone's just
gonna be sitting there going hey what
should i do I don't know what to do know
they're gonna be running to the
supermarket they're gonna be running to
the gas station they're gonna be trying
to get whatever they possibly can
especially if inflation hits because as
inflation hits the value of the dollar
decreases every single day in some cases
every single hour and they know if they
don't go now to get these supplies they
won't have enough later on to get them
and most likely they will not be able to
get them because credit will freeze up
at this time so we're going to be going
through this transition just like we
went through a transition back in the
70s it's going to be a little rough in
the beginning and remember we were
coming off the gold standard we didn't
have that much debt and we're moving on

where we have a huge amount of debt it's
based on nothing the middle east has

trade outside of the dollar most of the

moving away
from the reserve currency in this
country to another currency and
hopefully we have gold left most likely
many people think that we have nothing
nothing left and if we have nothing left
there's going to be huge problems here
in the US and remember this is because
of the central bankers the deep state
over the many many years preparing this
country for something completely
different and now it has to be prepared
for something different than they were

you'll see unemployment the numbers

like Toys R Us and things like that
you'll hear of businesses that are

people
the market will start to come down banks
will get into trouble because the
central bank the Fed doesn't have the

this is why you have Geithner and

listen maybe they should have maybe the

buying back their stocks corporations
I've been buying back their stocks and
when the stock market Falls guess what

we're gonna be going through this
transition and it's going to be
difficult for some those people who are

realize what's going to happen those

will always be king they're going to be

this was created by the central bank
this is not people's money this is a

and this has to be discontinued the
